S 0 313 0342 cipher March 10th, Your 95559 (M.1,1.) of Jan. 10th 1943 not to Middle East. 1, Understand unofficially Chinese Mission to Mideast will consist of Major—Oenoral Hu Hsien Chuan, Major-General Lam Wai Ching, Colonel Low Fang Chu, Major Huang Hsu Piao. 2, Hu is head of Mission. Some previous .o-spariorico mechanized units, Lam and Huang are Chinese ^ir ■t'orco offioors. Low is member of Chinese G.S. All speak English, 3, Despite request for one month's notice I understand party planning to leave Chungking for India on route Cairo towards end of March. I have warned ^hinoso D.M.I. lack of adequate notice to arrange air passage (?unwiso) with regal’d to delay in India. 4, Fill telegraph again as soon as I am officially notified proposed date of departure of Mission* 5, I am unofficially informed' Lew will remain in Cairo as M.A. after Mission concludes its trip. No repeat no official application for this has been made to (?Embassy) here who request you will inform F.O. 6, Please pass to Air Ministry for information* T.O.O. 0345 GMT. G.6 Telegrams. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 1463/43 'Chinese mission to the Middle East'

physicalDescription.extent: The file's contents are arranged in approximate chronological order, from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 6; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio

mods.abstract: The file comprises correspondence between the Military Attaché in China and the Commander-in-Chiefs in India and the Middle East as of March 1943. The mission starts from Chungking via Calcutta to Cairo. The mission was comprised of Major-General Hoo Hsien Chung, Major-General Lam Wai Ching, Colonel Lew Fang Chu and Major Hwang Hsu Piao. Hoo Hsien was the head of the Mission and Lam head of the Air Force. The Mission left Chungking for Calcutta by CNAC plane on 17 March 1943 and then left Calcutta on Sunday 21 March 1943.
